textRegions.text: I’m an API Engineer at Twilio.
We’re going to talk about helper libraries
It has the methods - all of them
No worries about hTTP, Auth, URLs, Params, etc
How can you keep them consistent across multiple languages with differing conventions?
How can you make it easy to maintain/update/support libraries across multiple languages?
That’s a lot of Code snippets
That’s a lot of Code snippets
- You can retrieve a participant from a Conference object by referencing a Call Sid.
- You can retrieve a member from a Queue object by referencing its sid.
- The Account object can retrieve UsageTriggers.
- You can create subaccounts via the Java library.
- Requests for Short Code resources will not 404.
- You can create new Queues via the Java library.
- You can delete Caller ID's via the Java library.
- Retrieve a list of your Connect Apps
- AuthorizedConnectApps no longer references nonexistent properties
- You can retrieve the Type of an Account ("Full", "Trial" etc)
- You can filter Accounts by a FriendlyName or Type
Bugs found before node.js library release
Oddness in the API manifests itself in every helper library
We started using it to guide design
We established conventions for creating/updating/filtering resources
Automatically get 100% test coverage for every library:
Ensure your libraries are hitting the correct URL’s
Snippet generation will inform the design of your API
Ensure consistency between resources, across libraries
Generate code snippets for any example you can think of
Try autogenerating code snippets for your API

Attribution
Flugtag: Bengt Nyman, “Kamikaze Splash Down”
Wrapping Up: Mike Baird, “Morro Rock at sunset”
